title: Datasets for Historians
text: sample data sets intended historians learning R. include population, institutional, religious, military, prosopographical data suitable mapping, quantitative analysis, network analysis.

title: Datasets for Historians
text: install package CRAN: install development version, first install devtools install package GitHub. install:

title: Datasets for Historians
text: list datasets package documentation: load dataset:

title: Datasets for Historians
text: dataset think good package, feel free contribute . can send dataset via e-mail can provide citation guarantee data available open license. much preferred contribute dataset via pull request. add dataset: Add raw data R script load save R data object data-raw/. .rda file saved data/. See data-raw/sarna.R model. Please try keeping data tidy. Add documentation using Roxygen format file R/. Use R/sarna.R model. sure include citation.

title: Datasets for Historians
text: project released MIT License: http://lmullen.mit-license.org/

Roman Catholic dioceses in the United States, Canada, and Mexico — catholic_dioceses
text: data frame 425 observations 6 variables.

title: Roman Catholic dioceses in the United States, Canada, and Mexico — catholic_dioceses
text: diocese: name, thus location, diocese. event, date: date diocese   erected, first founded, made metropolitan see.   Encoded date object. rite: rite overseen diocese. Regions ordinary   jurisdiction episcopal character included. lat, long: latitude longitude coordinates   headquarters city diocese.

title: Roman Catholic dioceses in the United States, Canada, and Mexico — catholic_dioceses
text: data compiled several sources: Joseph Bernard Code, Dictionary American Hierarchy   (1789-1964) (New York: Joseph F. Wagner, 1964), 425-26. United States since 1963, Canada, Mexicode:   http://www.catholic-hierarchy.org/

what: Wholesale Market Prices in Dijon, France 1568--1630 — dijon_prices
title: Wholesale Market Prices in Dijon, France 1568--1630 — dijon_prices
text: wholesale market prices city Dijon Burgundy central France 1568 1630. include major cereal grains, different qualities wine, dried legumes, oils used cooking, seeds, candle wax made beef tallow. prices generally recorded city council time year first market day feast St. Martin (November 11). prices sous tournois / 20 sous =  1 livre tournois.

title: Wholesale Market Prices in Dijon, France 1568--1630 — dijon_prices
Wholesale Market Prices in Dijon, France 1568--1630 — dijon_prices
text: dijon_prices data frame 1,110 observations 6   variables. dijon_prices_wide data frame 19 observations   65 variables. dijon_prices_wide contains data   transcribed; data converted tidy format   dijon_prices.

title: Wholesale Market Prices in Dijon, France 1568--1630 — dijon_prices
text: commodity: commodity sale measure:   amount commodity price price: price   sous tournais. citation, citation_date:   citations dates documents Archives municipales de Dijon.

title: Wholesale Market Prices in Dijon, France 1568--1630 — dijon_prices

title: Early colleges in the United States — early_colleges
text: data transcribed George Oberle table "  American Institutions Higher Education Founded 1848, Daniel   Walker Howe, Hath God Wrought: Transformation America,   1815-1848 (New York: Oxford University Press, 2007), 460-461.

text: George Oberle, George   Mason University Daniel Walker Howe

title: Early colleges in the United States — early_colleges
code: head(early_colleges) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   college                original_name       city  state established sponsorship #>   <chr>                  <chr>               <chr> <chr>       <int> <chr>       #> 1 Harvard                NA                  Camb… MA           1636 Congregati… #> 2 William and Mary       NA                  Will… VA           1693 Anglican    #> 3 Yale                   NA                  New … CT           1701 Congregati… #> 4 Pennsylvania, Univ. of NA                  Phil… PA           1740 Nondenomin… #> 5 Princeton              College of New Jer… Prin… NJ           1746 Presbyteri… #> 6 Columbia               King's College      New … NY           1754 Anglican    if(require(ggplot2)) {   ggplot(early_colleges, aes(x = established)) + geom_bar(binwidth = 5) +   ggtitle("Founding Dates of Early American Colleges") } #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Warning: Ignoring unknown parameters: `binwidth`

what: Federal judges in the United States of America — judges
title: Federal judges in the United States of America — judges
text: dataset contains information appointments careers federal judges United States history since 1789. includes judges "judges presidentially appointed good behavior served since 1789 U.S. District Courts, U.S. Courts Appeals, Supreme Court United States,  former U.S. Circuit Courts, federal judiciary's courts special jurisdiction." unnecessary information source excluded.

title: Federal judges in the United States of America — judges
text: Two data frames, judges_people judges_appointments.

title: Federal judges in the United States of America — judges
text: data frame judges_people contains information judges,   names vital information. data frame   judges_appointments contains information appointments,   name court, nominating president, dates   service.

title: Federal judges in the United States of America — judges
text: data taken   Biographical    Directory Federal Judges, 1789-present.

title: Federal judges in the United States of America — judges

what: Promotions of U.S. Navy officers, 1798-1849 — naval_promotions
title: Promotions of U.S. Navy officers, 1798-1849 — naval_promotions
text: dataset contains records careers officers line United States Navy became midshipmen 1798 1849. lists dates officers promoted ranks midshipment, lieutenant, master commandament, captain.

title: Promotions of U.S. Navy officers, 1798-1849 — naval_promotions
Promotions of U.S. Navy officers, 1798-1849 — naval_promotions
text: data frame 5,705 observations 4 variables.

title: Promotions of U.S. Navy officers, 1798-1849 — naval_promotions
text: id: unique numeric identifier officer. name: Name officer. generation: numeric value represent judgment   generations within officer corp U.S. Navy. First generation   officers entered service 1801, rank higher midshipman.   Second generation officers entered service Peace   Establishment Act (end 1801), midshipman. Thus,   essentially became adults service, learned craft   first generation. Third generation officers entered service   midshipmen Peace Establishment Act end War   1812. officers generation became captain rose   rank 1830s '40s. Fourth generation officers entered service   War 1812 ended. officers saw almost wartime   service, many ones achieved captain found   decide whether serve Union Confederacy Civil   War. rank: ranks officers obtained, including   midshipman, lieutenant, master_commandant,   captain. Also included dates officers   left_service. date: date character string officer   attained associated rank.

title: Promotions of U.S. Navy officers, 1798-1849 — naval_promotions
text: data compiled Abby Mullen Edward W. Callahan,   Officers Continental U.S. Navy Marine Corps,   1775-1900 (New York: L. R. Hamersly, 1901), made available via Naval   Historical Center,   http://www.ibiblio.org/hyperwar/NHC/Callahan/index.htm. See Mullen's   blog post compiling data,   "Database   Officers Line," abbymullen.org, January 5, 2013.

title: Promotions of U.S. Navy officers, 1798-1849 — naval_promotions
text: Abby Mullen, Northeastern University Edward W. Callahan

title: Promotions of U.S. Navy officers, 1798-1849 — naval_promotions
code: head(naval_promotions) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>      id name               generation rank       date       #>   <int> <chr>                   <int> <fct>      <chr>      #> 1     1 Abbot, Joel                 3 midshipman 1812-06-18 #> 2     2 Abbot, Trevett              4 midshipman 1848-10-13 #> 3     3 Abbott, Isaac               4 midshipman 1820-05-10 #> 4     4 Abbott, J. Francis          4 midshipman 1837-12-27 #> 5     5 Abbott, James W.            4 midshipman 1822-05-01 #> 6     6 Abbott, Thomas C.           3 midshipman 1814-12-06

what: Records of missions held by the Paulist Fathers, 1851--1893 — paulist_missions
title: Records of missions held by the Paulist Fathers, 1851--1893 — paulist_missions
text: dataset contains transcriptions records missions held  Paulist Fathers, Roman Catholic missionary order, nineteenth-century United States. dataset contains interesting data recorded full Paulist mission chronicles. founding members Paulist Fathers began members Redemptorist order. chronicles include missions held Redemptorists Paulists. transcription includes missions year 1893; Paulist Chronicles contain records transcribed , Paulists continued holding missions many years recorded Chronicles.

title: Records of missions held by the Paulist Fathers, 1851--1893 — paulist_missions
Records of missions held by the Paulist Fathers, 1851--1893 — paulist_missions
text: data frame 841 observations 17 variables.

title: Records of missions held by the Paulist Fathers, 1851--1893 — paulist_missions
text: mission_number: number assigned mission   Paulist Mission Chronicles. church: name church cathedral   mission held. city, state: location mission. start_date, end_date: start end dates   mission date objects. year: year mission. decade: decade mission (useful faceting). duration_days, duration_years: duration   mission days (integer) weeks (ordered factor). confessions: number confessions heard Paulists   mission, rough proxy number people   attended mission. converts: total number converts made mission   people left instruction conversion mission   . order: Whether mission held Redemptorist   Paulist order. lat, long: latitude longitude city   mission held. volume, page: location mission record   Paulist mission chronicles.

title: Records of missions held by the Paulist Fathers, 1851--1893 — paulist_missions
text: Paulist missions recorded Chronicle   Missions Given Congregation Missionary Priests St. Paul   Apostle, six manuscript volumes, Office Paulist History Archives,   North American Paulist Center, Washington, DC. Data transcribed Lincoln   Mullen.

title: Records of missions held by the Paulist Fathers, 1851--1893 — paulist_missions
text: Lincoln Mullen, George Mason   University

title: Records of missions held by the Paulist Fathers, 1851--1893 — paulist_missions
code: head(paulist_missions) #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>   mission_number church           city  state date_start date_end    year decade #>            <int> <chr>            <chr> <chr> <date>     <date>     <dbl> <chr>  #> 1              1 St. Joseph's Ch… New … NY    1851-04-06 1851-04-20  1851 1850s  #> 2              2 St. Michael's C… Lore… PA    1851-04-27 1851-05-11  1851 1850s  #> 3              3 St. Mary's Chur… Holl… PA    1851-05-18 1851-05-28  1851 1850s  #> 4              4 Church of St. J… John… PA    1851-05-31 1851-06-08  1851 1850s  #> 5              5 St. Peter's Chu… New … NY    1851-09-28 1851-10-12  1851 1850s  #> 6              6 St. Patrick's C… New … NY    1851-10-19 1851-11-03  1851 1850s  #> # ℹ 9 more variables: duration_days <int>, duration_weeks <ord>, #> #   confessions <int>, converts <int>, order <chr>, lat <dbl>, long <dbl>, #> #   volume <int>, page <int>

Presbyterians Statistics Through One Hundred Years — presbyterians
text: data frame 133 observations 37 variables.

title: Presbyterians Statistics Through One Hundred Years — presbyterians
text: Weber includes two sections, one raw data compiled Minutes General Assembly, apparently includes foreign membership Presbyterian churches. second section contains data Weber used visualizations, excludes foreign membership makes various calculations data. data Weber reproduced . data comes part 1, tables financial information excluded. One field varies title members received exam members received confession varies title, presumed refer process.

title: Presbyterians Statistics Through One Hundred Years — presbyterians
text: Weber, Herman C. Presbyterian Statistics One   Hundred Year, 1826--1926: Tabulated, Visualized, Interpreted.   Philadelphia: General Council, Presbyterian Church U.S.., 1927.   http://catalog.hathitrust.org/Record/007109885.

title: Presbyterians Statistics Through One Hundred Years — presbyterians

title: historydata 0.2 (in development)
text: Added dijon_prices dijon_prices_wide Added presbyterians Fixed data formatting paulist_missions Added methodists

title: historydata 0.1
text: CRAN release: 2014-12-24 Added sarna: Population estimates American Jews. Added us_state_populations`: Populations US states territories. Added catholic_dioceses: Locations dates founded Roman Catholic dioceses United States, Mexico, Canada. Added naval_promotions: Career data officers line early U.S. Navy. Added us_national_population: Populations United States America. Added early_colleges: Colleges founded United States 1848. Added paulist_missions: Missions held Paulists Fathers,1851-1893. Added judges_people judges_appointments: Federal judges, 1789–present. Added tudors: relationships among Tudor dynasty.
